alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 5:25AM EDT until April 01 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Laurens, Wilkinson, Johnson and Washington Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Johnson and Washington Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25 feet, Major flooding occurs. Most of Old Balls Ferry Road north of Georgia Highway 57 will be under one to three feet of water. The water level reaches the bottom of the USGS gaging equipment near the boat ramp. Widespread flooding up to several feet deep of the woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 17 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
